name: Avoid Cookie Misconfiguration (path) (PHP)
description: Cookies are often used to store a session identifier of the web application's state for a specific user. In order to harden against related attacks, such as session riding that can lead to the compromise of user data or the takeover of adminstrator sessions, a secure configuration of sensitive cookies is crucial. It has been detected that a new cookie is set insecure within the HTTP response header which can be improved by enabling additional flags.
output:
This report lists all artifacts that cause cookie misconfiguration. 
This QR provides the following information:
Artifact Full Name
rationale: The specified path for cookie should not be broad than necessary.
remediation: In order to increase security, the validity of the cookie can be limited to a more specific application path in the 4th parameter.

qualityStandards.name: Improper Authentication
qualityStandards.description: When an actor claims to have a given identity, the software does not prove or insufficiently proves that the claim is correct.

qualityStandards.name: Broken Authentication and Session Management
qualityStandards.description: Application functions related to authentication and session management are often not implemented correctly, allowing attackers to compromise passwords, keys, or session tokens, or to exploit other implementation flaws to assume other users' identities.

qualityStandards.name: Insecure Authentication
qualityStandards.description: Many older or poorly configured XML processors evaluate external entity references within XML documents.
